questions.title: Print Numbers 1 to N
questions.description:
Write a program that reads an integer N and prints all numbers from 1 to N, each on a new line.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** N numbers, each on a new line
**Example:**
- Input: 5
- Output: 1 2 3 4 5 (each on new line)
questions.solution_hint: Use a for loop starting from 1 to N

questions.title: Print Reverse Numbers N to 1
questions.description:
Write a program that reads an integer N and prints all numbers from N down to 1 in reverse order.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** N numbers in reverse, each on a new line
**Example:**
- Input: 5
- Output: 5 4 3 2 1 (each on new line)
questions.solution_hint: Use a for loop starting from N down to 1

questions.title: Sum of First N Numbers
questions.description:
Write a program to calculate and print the sum of first N natural numbers (1 + 2 + 3 + ... + N).

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** Sum of first N numbers
**Example:**
- Input: 5
- Output: 15 (because 1+2+3+4+5=15)
questions.solution_hint: Iterate from 1 to N and accumulate the sum

questions.title: Print Even Numbers 1 to N
questions.description:
Write a program that reads N and prints all even numbers from 1 to N.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** All even numbers from 1 to N, each on a new line
**Example:**
- Input: 10
- Output: 2 4 6 8 10
questions.solution_hint: Use a loop and check if number is divisible by 2

questions.title: Print Odd Numbers 1 to N
questions.description:
Write a program that reads N and prints all odd numbers from 1 to N.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** All odd numbers from 1 to N, each on a new line
**Example:**
- Input: 10
- Output: 1 3 5 7 9
questions.solution_hint: Use a loop and check if number is not divisible by 2

questions.title: Multiplication Table
questions.description:
Write a program that reads an integer N and prints the multiplication table of N from 1 to 10.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** N*1, N*2, ..., N*10 (space-separated on one line)
**Example:**
- Input: 5
- Output: 5 10 15 20 25 30 35 40 45 50
questions.solution_hint: Use a loop from 1 to 10 and multiply each by N

questions.title: Factorial of N
questions.description:
Write a program to calculate the factorial of N (N! = N × (N-1) × (N-2) × ... × 1).

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** Factorial of N
**Example:**
- Input: 5
- Output: 120 (because 5! = 5×4×3×2×1 = 120)
questions.solution_hint: Multiply all numbers from 1 to N

questions.title: Fibonacci Series
questions.description:
Write a program to print the first N Fibonacci numbers.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** First N Fibonacci numbers (space-separated)
**Example:**
- Input: 5
- Output: 0 1 1 2 3
questions.solution_hint: Start with 0 and 1, then each number is sum of previous two

questions.title: Prime Numbers Up to N
questions.description:
Write a program to find and print all prime numbers up to N.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** All prime numbers ≤ N (space-separated)
**Example:**
- Input: 20
- Output: 2 3 5 7 11 13 17 19
questions.solution_hint: Use Sieve of Eratosthenes for efficiency

questions.title: Pattern: Pyramid
questions.description:
Write a program to print a pyramid pattern of N rows.

**Input Format:** Single integer N
**Output Format:** Pyramid pattern
**Example:**
- Input: 3
- Output:
  ```
  *
  **
  ***
  ```
questions.solution_hint: Use nested loops - outer for rows, inner for stars

questions.title: Array Sum
questions.description:
Write a program that reads an array and prints the sum of all elements.

**Input Format:**
- First line: integer N (array size)
- Second line: N space-separated integers

**Output Format:** Sum of all array elements

**Example:**
- Input: 5\n1 2 3 4 5
- Output: 15
questions.solution_hint: Initialize sum to 0 and add each element

questions.title: Find Maximum Element
questions.description:
Write a program to find the maximum element in an array.

**Input Format:**
- First line: integer N
- Second line: N space-separated integers

**Output Format:** Maximum element

**Example:**
- Input: 5\n3 1 4 1 5
- Output: 5
questions.solution_hint: Compare each element and track the maximum

questions.title: Find Minimum Element
questions.description:
Write a program to find the minimum element in an array.

**Input Format:**
- First line: integer N
- Second line: N space-separated integers

**Output Format:** Minimum element

**Example:**
- Input: 5\n3 1 4 1 5
- Output: 1
questions.solution_hint: Compare each element and track the minimum

questions.title: Reverse an Array
questions.description:
Write a program to reverse an array and print it.

**Input Format:**
- First line: integer N
- Second line: N space-separated integers

**Output Format:** Reversed array (space-separated)

**Example:**
- Input: 5\n1 2 3 4 5
- Output: 5 4 3 2 1
questions.solution_hint: Iterate from end to start or use two pointers

questions.title: Array Rotation
questions.description:
Write a program to rotate an array right by K positions.

**Input Format:**
- First line: N (array size) and K (rotation count)
- Second line: N space-separated integers

**Output Format:** Rotated array (space-separated)

**Example:**
- Input: 5 2\n1 2 3 4 5
- Output: 4 5 1 2 3
questions.solution_hint: Use K = K % N to handle K > N

questions.title: Remove Duplicates
questions.description:
Write a program to remove duplicate elements from an array and print unique elements in order of first appearance.

**Input Format:**
- First line: integer N
- Second line: N space-separated integers

**Output Format:** Unique elements (space-separated)

**Example:**
- Input: 5\n1 2 2 3 1
- Output: 1 2 3
questions.solution_hint: Use a set to track seen elements

questions.title: String Length
questions.description:
Write a program that reads a string and prints its length.

**Input Format:** Single string
**Output Format:** Length of the string

**Example:**
- Input: hello
- Output: 5
questions.solution_hint: Count the number of characters

questions.title: Reverse String
questions.description:
Write a program that reads a string and prints it in reverse.

**Input Format:** Single string
**Output Format:** Reversed string

**Example:**
- Input: hello
- Output: olleh
questions.solution_hint: Iterate from end to start

questions.title: Check Palindrome
questions.description:
Write a program to check if a string is a palindrome (reads same forwards and backwards).

**Input Format:** Single string
**Output Format:** true or false

**Example:**
- Input: racecar
- Output: true
questions.solution_hint: Compare string with its reverse

questions.title: Anagram Check
questions.description:
Write a program to check if two strings are anagrams (contain same characters in different order).

**Input Format:**
- Line 1: First string
- Line 2: Second string

**Output Format:** true or false

**Example:**
- Input: listen\nsilent
- Output: true
questions.solution_hint: Sort characters or count frequency

questions.title: Linear Search
questions.description:
Write a program to find the first index of a target element in an array.

**Input Format:**
- Line 1: N (array size) and target
- Line 2: N space-separated integers

**Output Format:** Index of target (-1 if not found)

**Example:**
- Input: 5 3\n1 3 5 3 9
- Output: 1
questions.solution_hint: Iterate through array and compare each element
